title.narrative: Respond to COVID-19 Pandemic Through Supporting CCTCs

description.narrative:
The project aims to support 5 COVID Community Treatment Centers (CCTCs) for 8 months, which are the most effective ones out of the 13 centers currently functional and operated by UOSSM. These centers provide services for treating mild and moderate cases of COVID-19, as they are considered the largest percentage of confirmed cases, ensuring that only the severe cases in which the morbidity is high reach out to the case management hospitals and ICU.
The intervention in the project aims to address the gap in response to the COVID-19 pandemic in northwestern Syria (northwest rural Aleppo and Idlib) by supporting CCTCs, where surveys will be conducted for all suspected cases of COVID-19 that meet the criteria for the swab (PCR) to be taken and If it confirmed, mild and moderate cases will be admitted, quarantined and treated ( except that are asymptomatic with suitable home circumstances for quarantines ), thus containing the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic and reducing morbidity and mortality rates. The project also includes educating patients and teaching them how to use personal protective equipment and training them in practice.
These centers are located in Kafr Karmin, Atma, Sarmada, Armanaz, and Dana, which are in the hot area of OCHA allocation and have a population of (998861 for Dana District), 74430 for Armanaz District, and 176282 for Atarep District). The WHO indicated on August 14, 2020, that studies are varied about Covid morbidity, In any case, global studies indicate that approximately 20 - 40% of positive cases asymptomatic while, 60 - 80% symptomatic ( 5% of them needs ICU, 15% hospitalization, and 80% CCTCs ). According to the statistics of the previous 5 CCTCs, length of stay (Los), and the capacity, the number of beneficiaries was calculated at 333 per month for each center (1665 for 5 CCTC centers)The center will be as WHO/HC model that include 4 areas: 1- Triage (first acceptance area in which application filled and IPC s provided) 2- Screening and physical evaluation in which admission, referral or home quarantine decision will take 3- Observation and isolation in which admitted cases 4- Recovery when patient prepared to discharge.
